questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Users complain that the message waiting light on the IP phone does not light up when receiving a new voicemail. With which codec must the engineer configure a dial peer on Cisco UCME for MWI traffic to resolve this issue?

choices.B: Update the jabber-config.xml file with the correct voicemail parameters and restart the appropriate services.
choices.C: Add a primary voicemail service to Cisco UCM to allow Cisco Jabber users to receive voice messages.
choices.A: Add a secondary voicemail service to Cisco UCM to allow Cisco Jabber users to receive voice messages.
choices.D: Apply the voicemail service to a service profile so that the client can retrieve the settings.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting an issue with Cisco Jabber for Windows deployed in phone-only mode. The users are reporting that they cannot access voicemail services via the Cisco Jabber for Windows client on the corporate LAN. Which steps resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think B

Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/12_9/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-on-premises-129/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-on-premises-129_chapter_0110.pdf

Cisco Jabber does not read Voicemail UC Service Profile when it is deployed only in the Phone mode.
For Cisco Jabber to retrieve the voicemail server information, update the jabber-config.xml file with the
voicemail parameters.
<Voicemail>
<VoicemailService_UseCredentialsFrom>phone</VoicemailService_UseCredentialsFrom>
<VoicemailPrimaryServer>X.X.X.X</VoicemailPrimaryServer>
</Voicemail>
After updating, upload the jabber-config.xml file to all the Cisco Unified Communications Manager TFTP
servers and restart the TFTP service on TFTP server nodes. Then reset the Jabber client.

Selected Answer: CD
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/12_8/cjab_b_planning-guide-cisco-jabber-128/cjab_m_planning-contact-source-128.html

You can use the following contact source servers with Cisco Jabber:

Active Directory Domain Services for Windows Server 2012 R2

Active Directory Domain Services for Windows Server 2008 R2

Cisco Unified Communications Manager User Data Server (UDS). Cisco Jabber supports UDS using Cisco Unified Communications Manager version 10.5 or higher.

OpenLDAP

Active Directory Lightweight Directory Service (AD LDS) or Active Directory Application Mode (ADAM)

questions.question_text: Which two methods does Cisco Jabber use for contact searching in an on-premises deployment model? (Choose two.)

A collaboration engineer is configuring service discovery for Cisco Jabber clients with an on-premises Cisco IM and Presence deployment. Clients on the corporate network are working. Clients on the public internet cannot locate the corporate services. What must the engineer configure to enable service discovery for these clients?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
They do not specify if the phone is visible in the client. If the phone is visible and they cannot control it then it is the Allow Control of the Device From CTI on the phone (Option C). They do not say the phone is not listed.

choices.C: Add the “Allow control of the device from the CTI” option under the desk phone configuration page.
choices.B: Associate the User with the desk phone under the user configuration page on Cisco UCM.
choices.A: Add the “Allow control of the device from the CTI” option under the client services profile configuration page.
choices.D: Select “Primary Line” under the user configuration page on Cisco UCM.
